quarks.connectors.file.runtime

Interface IFileWriterPolicy<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - stream tuple type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileWriterPolicy

    public interface IFileWriterPolicy<T>
    An interface for file writer policies.

    IFileWriterPolicy is for use by file writer implementations for interacting with a policy implementation.

    A policy generally implements strategies related to:

    • Active and final file pathname control.
    • Active file flush control
    • Active file cycle control (when to close/finalize the current active file)
    • file retention control

    A file writer uses a IFileWriterPolicy in the following manner: 

     IFileWriterPolicy<T> policy = some policy implementation
 policy.initialize(basePathname, () -> myFlushFn(), () -> myCycleFn());
 Path activeFilePath = null;
 for each tuple {
   if (activePathFile == null) {
     activeFilePath = policy.getNextActivePath();
     open an output stream to the path
   }
   write the appropriate contents to the active file output stream
   policy.wrote(tuple, number of bytes written);
   if (policy.shouldCycle()) {
     close the active file output stream
     policy.closeActiveFile(activeFilePath);
     activeFilePath = null;
   } 
   if (policy.shouldFlush()) {
     flush the active file output stream
   }
 }
 policy.close();
 
 void myFlushFn() {
   flush the active file output stream
 }
 
 void myCycleFn() {
   close the active file output stream
   policy.closeActiveFile(activeFilePath);
   activeFilePath = null;
 }

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(java.lang.String basePathname,
                java.io.Flushable flushable,
                java.io.Closeable closeable)
        Initialize the policy with the base pathname of files to generate and objects that can be called to perform timer based flush or close (cycle) of the active file.

        Cycling involves finalizing the active file (getting it to its final destination / pathname) and applying any retention policy.

        The supplied closeable must close the active file's output stream and then call closeActiveFile(Path).

        For non-timer based strategies, the file writer generally triggers flush and cycle processing following a tuple write as informed by shouldCycle() and shouldFlush().

        Parameters:
        basePathname - the directory and base leafname for final files
        flushable -
        closeable -

      • wrote

        void wrote(T tuple,
           long nbytes)
        Inform the policy of every tuple written to the active file.

        The policy can use this to update its state so that it can answer the questions shouldFlush() and shouldCycle() for count, size, or tuple attribute based policies.

        The policy can also use this to update its state for implementing time based flush and cycle policies.

        Parameters:
        tuple - the tuple written
        nbytes - the number of bytes written

      • shouldFlush

        boolean shouldFlush()
        Answers the question "should the active file be flushed?".

        The state is reset to false after this returns.

        Returns:
        true if the active file should be flushed

      • shouldCycle

        boolean shouldCycle()
        Answers the question "should the active file be cycled?".

        The state is reset to false after this returns.

        Returns:
        true if the active file should be cycled

      • getNextActiveFilePath

        java.nio.file.Path getNextActiveFilePath()
        Return the path for the next active file to write to.

        If there was a current active file, closeActiveFile(Path) must be called prior to this.

        The leafname must be a hidden file (java.io.File.isHidden()==true to be compatible with a directory watcher FileStreams.directoryWatcher(quarks.topology.TopologyElement, quarks.function.Supplier)

        Returns:
        path for the active file

      • closeActiveFile

        java.nio.file.Path closeActiveFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Close the active file path.

        Generate the final path for the active file and rename/move/copy it as necessary to be at that final path.

        Apply the retention policy.

        The active file's writer iostream must be closed prior to calling this.

        Parameters:
        path - the active file (from getNextActiveFilePath()).
        Returns:
        the final path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        void close()
        Release any resources utilized by this policy.
